channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrowing foliage, 2nd August
item.description:
The foliage is too overgrown on from the pub and is causing issues with people walking on the pavement

item.title: Branches ripped off public trees outside Copperfields, 48 The Avenue, 2nd August
item.description:
Last night 2 branches were torn off public trees outside 48 and 50 The Avenue, Beckenham and left on the grass verge. Please can they be removed....thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned motorcycle, 2nd August
item.description:
A very damaged motorcycle has been dumped in my private garage at 7a Odeon Parade, Well Hall Road, Eltham SE9 6DX. It looks like it has been stolen and/ or in an accident. It has been left here in the past week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Odeon Parade, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree branch., 2nd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Further Green Road, Catford South, London

item.title: New signage and bollards in road, 2nd August
item.description:
Large signage so out of keeping with a conservation area has appeared at both ends of Northumberland Place. How can this be seen as appropriate? Also bollards are blocking the road preventing people parking in it. Why if access is permitted?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Northumberland Place, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish dumped, 2nd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, St Peters Lane, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Signage not appropriate for a conservation area, 2nd August
item.description:
It is so disappointing to see 2 enormous ugly yellow and white signs at each end of Northumberland Place. Extraordinarily out of keeping for a historic conservation area. Please change for signs more appropriate for the vernacular of the area and more in line with the conservation area rules for private individuals.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Northumberland Place, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet
